actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to amend title 49, United States Code, to encourage the use of zero-emission vehicles and technology at public-use airports, and for other purposes.
short_title: Generating Revenue for Electric and Emission-Negligible Vehicles at Airports Act
subjects: Hybrid, electric, and advanced technology vehicles

summary.text:
Generating Revenue for Electric and Emission-Negligible Vehicles at Airports Act or the GREEN Vehicles at Airports Act

This bill abolishes the inherently low emission airport vehicle pilot program and revises the pilot program the Department of Transportation (DOT) is authorized to establish under which sponsors of public-use airports may use funds to carry out activities associated with the acquisition and operation of eligible zero-emission vehicles and equipment.

DOT may establish a zero-emission technology program.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 49, United States Code, to encourage the use of zero-emission vehicles and technology at public-use airports, and for other purposes.
Generating Revenue for Electric and Emission-Negligible Vehicles at Airports Act
